intro: Aetheilema alopecuroidea, commonly known as the woolly grass. It is a flowering plant belonging to the Poaceae family, characterized by its dense, tufted growth habit and soft, hairy leaves. The plant is native to southern Africa, where it thrives in sandy or rocky soils. It produces small, pale blue to purple flowers that bloom in summer, attracting various pollinators. Its unique appearance and adaptability make it a notable species in its native habitat.
